thread.title: Kings reportedly trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans
thread.title_full: Kings reportedly trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans

author: Tom Biersdorfer
title: Kings reportedly trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans

organizations.name: demarcus cousins to pelicans demarcus cousins

text:
Kings reportedly trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans for three players and two draft picks Kings reportedly trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans DeMarcus Cousins is leaving Sacramento and teaming up with Anthony Davis in New Orleans. (Michael Reaves/Getty Images) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Monday, February 20, 2017, 12:08 AM 
It looks like the Kings’ All-Star center is going to Boogie his way right out of Sacramento. 
The Kings have reportedly agreed to trade DeMarcus “Boogie” Cousins to the New Orleans Pelicans, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of The Vertical. 
In exchange for Cousins, the Pelicans will send a 2017 first-round draft pick, a 2017 second-round pick, guard Buddy Hield, swingman Tyreke Evan and point guard Langston Galloway. 
Sacramento is also sending Omri Casspi to the Pelicans as part of the deal. 
Trade speculation, which was brewing all day Sunday, escalated when Cousins only played two minutes in Sunday night’s NBA All-Star Game. 
Cousins will join fellow All-Star big man Anthony Davis in the New Orleans frontcourt. Davis is fresh off winning the All-Star Game MVP award, scoring a game-record 52 points. 
Cousins is averaging 27.8 points and 19.7 rebounds per game this season. 
Cousins, 26, who has always displayed a lot of emotion during his seven-year NBA career, is facing a one-game suspension for picking up his 16th technical foul of the season last week. Join the Conversation:
